page.title: 02Upper Lutheredge Farm.
page.content: Upper Lutheredge Farm is on the outskirts of Nympsfield. The area of it is{300 acres.}There are{150 acres of permanent grassland for grazing cattle, some of it is very steep.The other{150 acres}consists of{50 acres} of woodland and{100 acres}of crops: wheat and barley. The farm was bought in{1960}at a cost of{Â£24,000.}It belonged to the Woodchester Estate.The farmhouse was built between 1520 and 1530. Rooms have been added on,through the years, to accommodate the younger members of the family when they married.The tiles from the old pigsties were used to roof part of the house.In front of the farmhouse are some straddle stones, across which bales of straw were placed. The farm has always been known as Upper Lutheredge Farm. It trades as Kinley Farms.
